page.title: 06A mothers day in Stratton
page.content: 7am start gives just enough time to rise, throw on jeans and sweat shirt, descend to kitchen and start preparing lunch boxes for husband and two children who shortly appear for porridge and toast. They are off to school by 8.10 leaving me plus baby to tackle household chores. Hopefully someone appears for coffee around 11. If it is to be a good day, will manage a beer in pub at lunchtime (the local is very obliging about baby, who sits on the floor with a packet of crisps). Afternoon walk is a must. Children arrive home about 4.30 On organised days supper appears on the table around 5.30 Normally I do not have time to digest mine before taking a child Cubs,Brownies or ballet by car. Once children are home, bathed and in bed will unwind hopefully with aid of large gin.
